lesson_name: Corrections: Format Consistency and Output Discipline
description: 8 simple examples reinforcing clean output format: no trailing tokens, no hallucinated follow-ups, consistent node naming. These are format-only corrections.

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that prints Ready on BeginPlay.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Ready
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Ready"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that destroys itself on BeginPlay.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SelfDestroy
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with integer Count at 0. On BeginPlay set Count to 5 and print the value.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SetCount
PARENT: Actor
VAR Count: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableSet [VarName=Count]
NODE n3: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA 5 -> n2.Value [Int]
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with bool IsReady. On BeginPlay if IsReady print Go. Else print Wait.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ReadyCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsReady: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsReady]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Go"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Wait"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap prints Touched and destroys the overlapping actor.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TouchDestroy
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Touched"]
NODE n3: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n3.Target [Actor]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay waits 2 seconds then prints Done.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayPrint
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay starts a looping timer every 3 seconds. The timer prints Tick.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TickTimer
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick", Time=3.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=OnTick]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Tick"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap casts to Character. If success print Player. If fail print Other.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CastCheck
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Player"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Other"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.CastFailed -> n4.Execute
